English: to clutch, lower part of stream
crack, notch on fish-fork, strength, taint
shoulderblade, warm shelter for large cattle
to be full, to stick into
to lie in a hole, to be ashamed
to drift on the surface, baste
part of cloth in the armpit
part of cloth in the armpit
to shake from side to side
to become hoarse, to tie up a horse
long hair on back of head
young pig, a k. of poplar
to burn, to go through, to dump
tether, rough and long steppe grass
foal up to one year old
part of body around the heart
file, to carry on the back
roast, to come back, become old
be deep in thoughts or in work
